realtimeweb.businesssearch.regular

Class Business

  • Object
    • realtimeweb.businesssearch.regular.Business

  • public class Business
extends Object
    A Business object represents a Business in the real world. It has a large number of properties associated with it to describe the Business.
    Author:
    acbart

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Business(Map<String,Object> raw)

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Creates a new String representation of this Business, which will include the businesses ID and Name.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A string representing the Business

      • getCategories

        public List<BusinessCategory> getCategories()
        Provides a list of the categories that this business falls under.
        Returns:
        A list of the categories that this business is in

      • getDeals

        public List<Deal> getDeals()
        Provides deal info for this business. If there are no deals, then the list will be empty.
        Returns:
        A list of the deals for this business

      • getDisplayPhone

        public String getDisplayPhone()
        Provides a phone number for this business that is especially human-readable.
        Returns:
        A string representation of this phone number.

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance()
        Returns the distance that business is from search location in meters, if a latitude/longitude was specified in the original search. Otherwise, it will return -1.
        Returns:
        The distance from the search location, or -1.

      • getGiftCertificates

        public List<GiftCertificate> getGiftCertificates()
        Returns a list of Gift certificates for this business. If there are no gift certificates, the list will be empty.
        Returns:
        the giftCertificates

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Returns the Yelp ID for this business. A Yelp ID is a string of characters that uniquely identifies this business, like '5Ji5L2GF0ppuwVyC_ET6mg' or 'uyrIgOpomZhXXbYHPx951w'.
        Returns:
        The unique id for this business.

      • getImageUrl

        public String getImageUrl()
        Provides the URL of photo for this business.
        Returns:
        A url expressed as a String.

      • getLocation

        public DetailedLocation getLocation()
        Returns the location of this business. A lot of information is provided, so a DetailedLocation is returned.
        Returns:
        The detailed location of this business.

      • getMobileUrl

        public String getMobileUrl()
        The URL for the mobile business page on Yelp. This is suitable for loading the businesses page on a mobile-device.
        Returns:
        A string representing the mobile-friendly URL.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        The human-readable name of this Business.
        Returns:
        The name.

      • getPhone

        public String getPhone()
        The Phone number for this business with international dialing code (e.g. +442079460000). If you want to display the number to humans, consider getDisplayPhone() instead.
        Returns:
        the phone

      • getRatingImageUrl

        public String getRatingImageUrl()
        The URL to the 5-Star Rating image for this business. A business can have 1-5 stars. The image given by this URL is 84px by 17px.
        Returns:
        The url to the image of the rating.

      • getRatingImageUrlLarge

        public String getRatingImageUrlLarge()
        A link to a larger version of the 5-star Rating image. The image linked will be 166px by 30px. See getRatingImageUrl() for more information about the image returned by this function.
        Returns:
        The URL to the image of the rating.

      • getRatingImageUrlSmall

        public String getRatingImageUrlSmall()
        A link to a smaller version of the 5-star Rating image. The image linked will be 50px by 10px. See getRatingImageUrl() for more information about the image returned by this function.
        Returns:
        The URL to the image of the rating.

      • getReviewCount

        public int getReviewCount()
        Provides the number of reviews for this business.
        Returns:
        The review count.

      • getReviews

        public List<Review> getReviews()
        Returns a list of the reviews associated with this business. There will be up to 3 reviews; if there are none, an empty list is returned.
        Returns:
        The list of reviews.

      • getSnippetImageUrl

        public String getSnippetImageUrl()
        Provides the URL of snippet image associated with this business.
        Returns:
        The URL of snippet image.

      • getSnippetText

        public String getSnippetText()
        Provides the Snippet text associated with this business.
        Returns:
        the Snippet .Text

      • getUrl

        public String getUrl()
        Provides the URL for business page on Yelp. If you want to get a version of the page suited for mobile devices, consider getMobileUrl().
        Returns:
        The URL of the business page on Yelp.

      • isClaimed

        public boolean isClaimed()
        Returns whether the business page has been claimed by the owner.
        Returns:
        Whether the page has been claimed.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Returns whether the business has been permanently closed.
        Returns:
        Whether the business is closed.

      • getRating

        public float getRating()
        Returns the rating for this business (value ranges from 1, 1.5, ... 4.5, 5). If you want to get an image representation of this rating, you can use getRatingImageUrl(), and if you want a smaller or larger version you can use getRatingImageUrlLarge() or getRatingImageUrlSmall().
        Returns:

      • setIsComplete

        void setIsComplete(boolean isComplete)
        An internal method to signal that this Business is only a preview, as opposed to a full view.
        Parameters:
        isComplete -

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Returns whether this is a fully-defined Business (gotten via a getBusinessData call), or just a shallow preview returned via a SearchResponse. If the latter, then you can use getBusinessData to fill out its information.
        Returns:

      • fillIn

        void fillIn(Map<String,Object> raw)
        This is an internal method, please ignore it.

        Fills in any missing data to this Business from a given map.
        Parameters:
        raw -
